Language & Word Origins.name: Global Gab: A Linguistic Journey
Language & Word Origins.description: Explore the fascinating roots of words and phrases from around the world. This quiz tests your knowledge of languages, cultural influences, and the surprising origins of everyday terms.

questions.text: What is actor Antonio Banderas native language?
questions.hint: He hails from a country where this Romance language is spoken.

questions.text: What does the Yiddish word 'meshuga' mean?
questions.hint: This term is often used to describe someone acting wildly or irrationally.

questions.text: From what language does the term 'R.S.V.P.' originate?
questions.hint: This language is associated with etiquette and diplomacy, often used in formal invitations.

Language & Word Origins.name: Lexical Labyrinth: Wordplay & Definitions
Language & Word Origins.description: Navigate a maze of vocabulary and grammatical concepts. This quiz challenges your understanding of word structure, meaning, and usage, from adverbs to anagrams.

questions.text: Which of these words is an adverb?
questions.hint: This word modifies a verb, often ending in ‘-ly’ to describe how something is done.

questions.text: What term describes a word created by rearranging the letters of another word?
questions.hint: For example, ‘listen’ and ‘silent’ are this type of word pair.

questions.text: What is the name of the fruit that is half tangerine and half grapefruit?
questions.hint: The name is a blend of the two parent fruits, starting with 'tang.'

questions.text: What does the acronym 'REM' stand for?
questions.hint: This term describes a sleep phase linked to dreaming and brain activity.

questions.text: Which of these words is spelled correctly?
questions.hint: This word relates to cleanliness and has a ‘g’ and ‘e’ in its spelling.

questions.text: Which of these words is a synonym for 'perambulate'?
questions.hint: This word describes a leisurely walk, similar to ‘perambulate.’

questions.text: From what language does the term 'R.S.V.P.' originate?
questions.hint: This language is associated with etiquette and diplomacy, often used in formal invitations.
